update.description:
Depends on ign-sensors [pull request #42](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/42/separate-out-rendering-sensor-classes-and/diff)

Ign-sensors is undergoing some refactoring work and the updates here enable the sensors system to work with the new ign-sensors rendering component
update.title: [Blueprint] Depend on ign-sensors rendering component

content.raw: I had thought about adding an accessor function to SceneManager to return its `scene` so we would not need the pointer here. But I was trying to avoid making too many changes to SceneManager since it was added as temporary workaround to get cameras working.
content.html: I had thought about adding an accessor function to SceneManager to return its scene so we would not need the pointer here. But I was trying to avoid making too many changes to SceneManager since it was added as temporary workaround to get cameras working.

content.raw: The scene manager also keeps a pointer to the scene. I haven't looked through the other PRs, I was just wondering if this is a transition stage where the pointer is kept in 2 places, or if this is the end goal?
content.html: The scene manager also keeps a pointer to the scene. I haven't looked through the other PRs, I was just wondering if this is a transition stage where the pointer is kept in 2 places, or if this is the end goal?

content.raw:
Bumped in 513134c.

We need to update the `ign-sensors2` homebrew formula.

[This](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/792/ign-gazebo-blueprint-dependencies-from/diff) should build rendering and sensors from source on Jenkins.
content.html:
Bumped in 513134c.

We need to update the ign-sensors2 homebrew formula.

This should build rendering and sensors from source on Jenkins.

content.raw: `INTEGRATION_logical_sensor_system` test is failing on pipelines.  I tried running another [pipelines build](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/{f7e2057a-8234-4c85-bd02-bc850d1fcc59}) using ign-gazebo `default` branch against ign-sensors' `default` branch and the test fails there too
content.html: INTEGRATION_logical_sensor_system test is failing on pipelines. I tried running another pipelines build using ign-gazebo default branch against ign-sensors' default branch and the test fails there too

content.raw:
I targeted this to `default` because the ign-sensors pull request needs to go in ignition-sensors2 \(it’s deprecating some functions\). 

I think we won’t be changing the ign-sensors version dependency in ign-gazebo1 so this can just go into ign-gazebo2 / blueprint
content.html:
I targeted this to default because the ign-sensors pull request needs to go in ignition-sensors2 (it’s deprecating some functions).

I think we won’t be changing the ign-sensors version dependency in ign-gazebo1 so this can just go into ign-gazebo2 / blueprint

content.raw: do you want to target `ign-gazebo1` or default?
content.html: do you want to target ign-gazebo1 or default?
